summary: Massive amounts of traceable data about military personnel and operations now exist due to the digital revolution. When aggregated, these "digital footprints" can threaten military personnel and their families, operations, and ultimately national security. The Department of Defense identifies publicly available data as a growing threat and has taken steps to inform service members of the risk. For example, a poster at DOD reads "Loose...
title: Information Environment: DOD Needs to Address Security Risks of Publicly Accessible Information
